bioghist.p: Charles Augustus Poulson Jr., grandson of Library Company of Philadelphia librarian Zachariah Poulson, was a publisher, antiquarian, and amateur historian. He compiled several series of scrapbooks of Philadelphia history, which were bequeathed to the Library Company following his death in 1866.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of scrapbooks predominately containing newspaper clippings, many dated between 1850 and 1860, describing the history, society, built environment, and political climate of Philadelphia. Other subject matter includes local anecdotes, price lists, mortality charts, tax lists, and year chronologies. Also contains periodical illustrations, advertisements, and prints showing businesses, churches, benevolent institutions, public and municipal buildings, household furnishings and implements, and social satires, several with an Afro-Americana or fashion content.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
